columns.name: gateway_id
columns.description: Unique identifier of the gateway record (primary key).

columns.name: name
columns.description: Human-readable gateway name/label (often used as an operational identifier).

columns.name: serial_number
columns.description: Hardware serial number of the gateway device, if available.

columns.name: transfer_protocol
columns.description: File/data transfer protocol used by the gateway (e.g., FTP).

columns.name: power_supply
columns.description: Power supply type/source for the gateway (e.g., main supply, battery, solar).

columns.name: installation_date
columns.description: Installation date of the gateway (as stored in the database).

columns.name: operating_team
columns.description: Team responsible for operating/maintaining this gateway.

columns.name: x
columns.description: X coordinate of the gateway location (coordinate system depends on your GIS conventions).

columns.name: y
columns.description: Y coordinate of the gateway location (coordinate system depends on your GIS conventions).

columns.name: z
columns.description: Z coordinate / elevation of the gateway location, if provided.

columns.name: time_zone
columns.description: IANA time zone used for interpreting timestamps for this gateway (e.g., 'Europe/Paris').

columns.name: geom
columns.description: Geospatial geometry representation of the gateway location (often WKT/GeoJSON or a serialized geometry).

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: Timestamp when this gateway record was created.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.description: Timestamp when this gateway record was last updated.

columns.name: provider
columns.description: Identifier of the provider/vendor associated with the gateway (likely a foreign key to a providers table).

sample_rows_note: Sample rows indicate many fields may be null in practice (e.g., serial_number, coordinates, geom, operating_team), while transfer_protocol and time_zone are commonly populated.
